title: How to Copy and Paste Pictures: Windows, Mac, iPhone, + Android

steps.title: Right-click the picture using your mouse or trackpad.
steps.content: Right-click the picture using your mouse or trackpad. If using a trackpad, depending on your computer's settings you can perform a right-click by either using two fingers to click the trackpad or by tapping the far-right side of the trackpad with a single finger. You can copy pictures from your web browser or from image files stored on your computer. If you're copying an image file, left-click it using your mouse or trackpad to select it first. If you want to copy more than 1 image file, select multiple files by holding down Ctrl and clicking on those you want to select.

steps.title: Click Copy or Copy Image.
steps.content: Click Copy or Copy Image . The image or file will be copied to the Clipboard (a type of temporary storage) on your computer. Alternatively, press Ctrl + C after selecting the file. In many applications, you can also click Edit in the menu bar, then click Copy .

steps.title: Right-click in the document or location where you want to paste the image.
steps.content: Right-click in the document or location where you want to paste the image. This will open the right-click options menu. [1] X Research source For files, click in the folder where you want to place them.

steps.title: Click Paste.
steps.content: Click Paste . The image will be inserted into the document or field at the place where you put the cursor. Alternatively, press Ctrl + V . In many applications, you can also click Edit in the menu bar, then click Paste .

steps.title: Right-click the picture using your mouse or trackpad.
steps.content: Right-click the picture using your mouse or trackpad. If using a trackpad, depending on your computer's settings you can perform a right-click by either using two fingers to click the trackpad or by tapping the far-right side of the trackpad with a single finger. You can copy pictures from your web browser or from image files stored on your computer. If you're copying an image file, left-click it using your mouse or trackpad to select it first. If you want to copy more than 1 image file, select multiple files by holding down ⌘ and clicking on those you want to select. If you don't have a right-click function, press Control + click on Mac, then click Copy in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Copy or Copy Image.
steps.content: Click Copy or Copy Image . The image or file will be copied to the Clipboard (a type of temporary storage) on your computer. Alternatively, press ⌘ + C while the image file is selected to copy it to the Clipboard. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click in the document or field where you want to insert the image.
steps.content: Click in the document or field where you want to insert the image. For files, click in the folder where you want to place the images.

steps.title: Click Edit in the menu bar.
steps.content: Click Edit in the menu bar.

steps.title: Click Paste or Paste Item.
steps.content: Click Paste or Paste Item . The image will be inserted into the document or field at the place where you put the cursor. Alternatively, ⌘ + V . You can also right-click on the mouse or trackpad. If you don't have a right-click function, press Control + click on Mac, then click Paste in the pop-up menu. [3] X Research source You can paste the image directly into Photoshop to resize it or edit it!

steps.title: Select the image you want to copy.
steps.content: Select the image you want to copy. To do so, long tap the picture until a menu appears. Copy and paste is an essential technology feature, even on smartphones! [4] X Research source You can copy pictures from your web browser or from image files stored on your smartphone.

steps.title: Tap Copy.
steps.content: Tap Copy . The image will be copied to the Clipboard (temporary storage) on your device. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Long tap on a document or field where you want to insert the image.
steps.content: Long tap on a document or field where you want to insert the image. An options menu will appear. If it's in a different app from the one in which you're copying, open the other app and navigate to where you want to paste the image.

steps.title: Tap Paste.
steps.content: Tap Paste . The image will be inserted into the document or field at the place where you put the cursor. You've successfully copy and pasted an image using your iPhone or iPad. [6] X Research source Next, check out how to copy and paste a link .

steps.title: Select the image you want to copy.
steps.content: Select the image you want to copy. To do so, long tap the picture until a menu appears. [7] X Research source You can copy pictures from your web browser or from image files stored on your smartphone.

steps.title: Tap Copy.
steps.content: Tap Copy . The image will be copied to the Clipboard (temporary storage) on your device. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Long tap on a document or field where you want to insert the image.
steps.content: Long tap on a document or field where you want to insert the image. This will open an options menu. If it's in a different app from the one in which you're copying, open the other app and navigate to the location where you want to paste the image.

steps.title: Tap Paste.
steps.content: Tap Paste . The image will be inserted into the document or field at the place where you put the cursor. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click the picture you want to copy.
steps.content: Click the picture you want to copy. In a Microsoft Office app like Word, PowerPoint, or Excel, clicking the image will select it. You can press Ctrl (Windows) or ⌘ (Mac) while clicking on images to select multiple pictures.

steps.title: Click the Home and then the Copy button.
steps.content: Click the Home and then the Copy button. It's an icon with two pieces of paper. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click in the document where you want to place the image.
steps.content: Click in the document where you want to place the image.

steps.title: Click the Paste button.
steps.content: Click the Paste button. This is in the Home tab. Doing so will paste the image you copied where you placed the cursor. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the image to select it.
steps.content: Click the image to select it. This can be an image in any Google Workspace app, such as Docs, Slides, and Sheets.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+C (Windows) or ⌘+C to copy the image.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + C (Windows) or ⌘ + C to copy the image. This will save the image to your temporary storage known as the Clipboard. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Click in the document where you want to place the image.
steps.content: Click in the document where you want to place the image.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+V (Windows) or ⌘+V to paste the image.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + V (Windows) or ⌘ + V to paste the image. It will appear where you placed your cursor. [13] X Research source
